problem.markdown:
A validation rule compares the following 2 data elements: -Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years -Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years Using best practice, select the correct option for creating this rule:
>>Select the one correct answer: (2 attempts)<<
( ) A. Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years == Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years ( ) B. Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years >= Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years ( ) C.Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years <= Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years (x) D. Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years <= Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years
[explanation] In this scenario, the number of confirmed cases identified by RDT should be less then or equal to the number of RDT tests performed. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.p: A validation rule compares the following 2 data elements:
Using best practice, select the correct option for creating this rule:
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Select the one correct answer: (2 attempts)

choicegroup.choice: A. Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years == Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years
B. Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years >= Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years
C.Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years <= Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years
D. Malaria RDT confirmed OPD < 5 years <= Malaria RDT done OPD < 5 years

div.p: In this scenario, the number of confirmed cases identified by RDT should be less then or equal to the number of RDT tests performed.
